intro: Conanthus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered conanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its small, white or pale blue flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Conanthus parviflorus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with suitable climate conditions.
